data.name: err000
data.value: Error while loading a Packed File.

data.name: ask000
data.value: Do you want to stop the Extraction?

data.name: err003
data.value: Error while trying to replace a packed File with {0}.

data.name: err004
data.value: Error while trying to open a recent File.

data.name: errregistry
data.value: Error while trying to access the Registry

data.name: askdelete
data.value: Do you really want to delete the selected Files?

data.name: err005
data.value: Error while trying to delete a Packed File

data.name: err006
data.value: Error while tyring to add a Packed File

data.name: err007
data.value: Unable to Maximize Interesst of all Sims

data.name: cantcommitfamt
data.value: Can't commit the Family Tie File.

data.name: cantcommittie
data.value: Can't commit the changes for the current Tie.

data.name: cantaddtie
data.value: Can't add this Sime to the Tie List

data.name: cantcommitobjd
data.value: Can't commit the changes to the Object Data File.

data.name: byteviewerror
data.value: Error while displaying the Byte View

data.name: usebigfile?
data.value: This File is bigger than 10kb, load it anyway? (This will take a While!)

data.name: backuprestore
data.value: Would you like to create a copy of the current Neighborhood before you overwrite it with this Backup?

data.name: backupdelete
data.value: Do you really want to delete all Files stored in {0}?

data.name: disclaimer
data.value:
SimPE is a Tool that can be used to change the internal Data of "The Sims 2".
Many People have used SimPE without problems. However, if you are not carefull this Tool can damage your Game or even your System. Do not use SimPE if you don't want to take that Risk! Remeber SimPE is in its alpha Stage! Please make sure you have a working backup copy of "My Documents\EA Games\The Sims 2\" before you start SimPE.
Start SimPE now?

data.name: savechanges
data.value: Do you want to save the Changes made to the Package "{filename}"?

data.name: unsavedchanges
data.value:
Some Files in the Package have unsaved changes which will be lost when you open a new neighborhood.
Do you want to continue anyway?

data.name: savewrapperchanges
data.value:
Do you want to commit the Changes made to the Resource "{name}"?
Package: {filename}

data.name: OW_Warning
data.value:
In order for this Feature to work on Objects that are not yet Color Enabled, you need two download and install the Colour Options Enabler from http://sims.ambertation.de/download.shtml .

This Feature is still in the Beta Testing Stages and might no work correct. Please don't distribute Recolors created with this Tool without mentioning that it is Testing or Beta Release, and don't forget that the USers of the Recolors will also need the Colour Options Enabler!

Continue anyway?

data.name: open_wnt_from_sdsc
data.value: Do you want to commit the changes for this Sim before you open the Wants & Fears?"

data.name: open_fami_from_sdsc
data.value: Do you want to commit the changes for this Sim before you open the Family Information?"

data.name: open_dna_from_sdsc
data.value: Do you want to commit the changes for this Sim before you open the DNA Information?"

data.name: open_cloth_from_sdsc
data.value: Do you want to commit the changes for this Sim before you open the Clothing File?"

data.name: reschanged
data.value:
The Resource "{name}" was changed. Should SimPe reload it?
Package: {filename}

data.name: get_qa_release
data.value:
A new QA Version has been released.
You can get it at http://ambertation.de/simpeforum/forum/viewforum/14.

data.name: cache_cleared
data.value: "The cache was cleared. In order to complete the Operation, you have to restart SimPE!"

data.name: Fix_Fence_Warning
data.value:
"Making a Fence compatible with the Original Game, is a nasty Hack, which can cause conflicts in the Game. I would not suggest to do this, if you plan to Release the Fence!
If you still want to offer the Fence for the original Game, please consider to release it in two seperate Packages. One with the Fence for University and higher, and one for the Original Game.
Do you really want to make this Fence compatible with the original Game?"

data.name: Censor_Install_Warn
data.value:
You have installed Nightlife (or a newer Expansion). This means, that SimPE needs to copy a File into your Config folder, in order to remove the Blur.
Do you want to continue?

data.name: Censor_UnInstall_Warn
data.value:
In order to bring the Blur back, SimPE has to delete the file {filename}.
Do you want to continue?

data.name: PresetChanged
data.value:
The Look and Feel of SimPE was changed to "{name}".
Do you want to start SimPE now?

data.name: ObsoleteOW
data.value:
The windowed ObjectWorkshop is obsololete. Please use the dockable ObjectWorkshop.
You should use the dockable ObjectWorkshop, which can be activated with the "Windows->ObjectWorkshop" Menu.
Continue anyway?

data.name: [Description:]
data.value:
This should contain the installation directory of '{LongName}'. The given Folder must contain a subfolder called 'TSData'.
If this is empty, SimPE will use the default Folder.

data.name: [Description:SaveGamePath]
data.value:
This should contain the savegame directory of "The Sims 2". The given Folder must contain subfolders called "Downloads" and "Neighborhoods".
If this is empty, SimPE will use the default Folder.

data.name: [Description:NvidadPath]
data.value: This should contain the Folder pointing to the Nivida DDS Tool.

data.name: Reset Filetable
data.value:
SimPE needs to reset your FileTable. This means, that SimPe will delete the File "{flname}".
Do you want SimPe to reset your FileTable?

data.name: Reset Cache
data.value:
The format for the SimPe Cache was extended. This was done to support new Features from "Open for Business". For them to work correct, SimPe has to reset it's Cache. This means, that SimPe will delete the File "{flname}".
Do you want SimPe to reset the Cache?

data.name: Unknown EP found
data.value:
SimPE detected a new Expansion Pack for "The Sims 2".
This SimPE Version does only work with Game Versions up to "{name}". Newer Game Files might cause Errors when opened with this Version of SimPE! (For more Informations, please visit http://sims.ambertation.de/en/).
Run SimPE anyway?

data.name: NO_CRES_FOUND
data.value:
The parent CRES was not found.
This means, that SimPE is unable to build the Joint Hirarchy.

data.name: UpdatesAvailable
data.value: There are new Updates available. Should SimPE display the Version Information?

data.name: NoDotNet
data.value:
SimPE detected that you run .NET {VERSION} on your System.
In order for SimPE to run correct, you need to install .NET 2.0.

data.name: InLocalMode
data.value:
This SimPE Session is running in local Mode. That means SimPE will never load the FileTable by itself, making small changes to packages much faster.
You can force SimPE to load the Filetable by clicking on the "Reload FileTable" Button.

data.name: NoPlugins
data.value: You also set SimPE to not load Plugins.

data.name: [Description:KeepFilesOpen]
data.value: When true, this improves performance by keeping "in use" files open. When false, files are closed at the earliest opportunity, releasing resources and allowing the files to be used by other programs.

data.name: NoErrors
data.value: SimPe will not display serious internal errors when they occur. You are strongly advised to make no changes and certainly not to save any packages.

data.name: cbautobak_CheckedChanged
data.value: Warning: Do not try to restore live game data such as sims, lots or neighborhoods from .bak files.

data.name: [Description:AddSimNames]
data.value: When true, for resources that are associated with Sims, the Sim's name will be applied. (This can have an adverse effect on performance.)

data.name: [Description:HackerMode]
data.value: When true, this attempts to improve performance by reducing the number of resources in use.

data.name: spOKCancelExists
data.value: OK to overwrite existing profile, Cancel to abort

data.name: spOKCancelCreate
data.value: OK to create new profile, Cancel to abort

data.name: spWrittenDesc
data.value: Your profile has been written. Use the "-profile savedprofilename" command line option to run SimPe with this profile.
